svg.text:
title: "Week in Ethereum News
September 2, 2023" date: "2023-09-02"
Eth News and Links
Dencun (Cancun + Deneb) upgrade
* Latest all core devs â€“ execution (ACDE) call video . Recap by Tim Beiko .Â Notes
from Tim Beiko and Christine Kim : Devnet 8 to be used for most Dencun testing, devnet
9 will include final spec changes & hopefully be the last devnet Public testnet
upgrade order: HoleÅ¡ky (new, smaller number of node operators), Goerli (deprecated,
has most apps/L2s/stakers) and then Sepolia before mainnet HoleÅ¡ky to test 3/6
(target/max) blobs with option to reduce to 2/4 for other testnets/mainnet Discussions
on Verkle trie live migration vs combining with state expiry and Address Space
Extension/Compression
Latest all core devs â€“ execution (ACDE) call video . Recap by Tim Beiko .Â Notes from
Tim Beiko and Christine Kim :
* Devnet 8 to be used for most Dencun testing, devnet 9 will include final spec
changes & hopefully be the last devnet
Devnet 8 to be used for most Dencun testing, devnet 9 will include final spec changes
& hopefully be the last devnet
* Public testnet upgrade order: HoleÅ¡ky (new, smaller number of node operators),
Goerli (deprecated, has most apps/L2s/stakers) and then Sepolia before mainnet
Public testnet upgrade order: HoleÅ¡ky (new, smaller number of node operators), Goerli
(deprecated, has most apps/L2s/stakers) and then Sepolia before mainnet
* HoleÅ¡ky to test 3/6 (target/max) blobs with option to reduce to 2/4 for other
testnets/mainnet
HoleÅ¡ky to test 3/6 (target/max) blobs with option to reduce to 2/4 for other
* Discussions on Verkle trie live migration vs combining with state expiry and Address
Space Extension/Compression
Discussions on Verkle trie live migration vs combining with state expiry and Address
* Intro to blobspace : EIP4844 (proto-danksharding) in Dencun upgrade & full
danksharding
Intro to blobspace : EIP4844 (proto-danksharding) in Dencun upgrade & full
Centralization watch: threatening the value of your ETH
* ðŸš¨ðŸš¨ðŸš¨ Lido very close to breaching 33% threshold
ðŸš¨ðŸš¨ðŸš¨ Lido very close to breaching 33% threshold
* Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ): Execution layer: Geth supermajority,
could possibly cause a chain split Consensus layer: two clients over 33%, a bug could
mean loss of finality
Client diversity (via clientdiversity.org ):
* Execution layer: Geth supermajority, could possibly cause a chain split
Execution layer: Geth supermajority, could possibly cause a chain split
* Consensus layer: two clients over 33%, a bug could mean loss of finality
Consensus layer: two clients over 33%, a bug could mean loss of finality
* Needed: more geographic diversity for both stakers and nodes , particularly outside
of US/Can/EU
Needed: more geographic diversity for both stakers and nodes , particularly outside of
US/Can/EU
Layer 1
* Ethereum Execution Layer Specification (EELS): Python reference implementation
(similar to consensus layer Python spec) Grant available to update Yellow Paper with
missing pre-merge fork logic
Ethereum Execution Layer Specification (EELS): Python reference implementation
(similar to consensus layer Python spec)
* Grant available to update Yellow Paper with missing pre-merge fork logic
* Erigon Caplin (CL client) roadmap
Erigon Caplin (CL client) roadmap
* Dapplion: Whisk bootstrapping , tradeoffs of bootstrapping strategies
Dapplion: Whisk bootstrapping , tradeoffs of bootstrapping strategies
* Otterscan v1.32.0 : adds contract interaction (for Sourcify verified contracts)
Otterscan v1.32.0 : adds contract interaction (for Sourcify verified contracts)
Client releases
* Consensus layer: Lodestar v1.11.0 : adds HoleÅ¡ky testnet
Consensus layer:
* Lodestar v1.11.0 : adds HoleÅ¡ky testnet
* Execution layer: Nethermind v1.20.2 / v1.20.3 : adds HoleÅ¡ky testnet Reth
v0.1.0-alpha.8 : sub 1TB full node, configurable pruning for each table and
improvements for Transaction Pool & RPC
Execution layer:
* Nethermind v1.20.2 / v1.20.3 : adds HoleÅ¡ky testnet
Nethermind v1.20.2 / v1.20.3 : adds HoleÅ¡ky testnet
* Reth v0.1.0-alpha.8 : sub 1TB full node, configurable pruning for each table and
Reth v0.1.0-alpha.8 : sub 1TB full node, configurable pruning for each table and
Research
* Decouple attestation weight from attestation rewards, proposal to reduce risks from
liquid staking
Decouple attestation weight from attestation rewards, proposal to reduce risks from
* Cumulative non-expiring inclusion lists , add-on to inclusion list design
Cumulative non-expiring inclusion lists , add-on to inclusion list design
* Slashing penalties if max effective balance increased (EIP7251), proposes initial
penalty be a constant or scale sublinearly and correlation penalty be modified to
scale quadratically
Slashing penalties if max effective balance increased (EIP7251), proposes initial
* PEPC-DVT : Protocol-Enforced Proposer Commitments without changing consensus
PEPC-DVT : Protocol-Enforced Proposer Commitments without changing consensus
Layer 2
* Arbitrum Stylus : build apps for Nitro chains in Rust, C & C++, live on testnet
Arbitrum Stylus : build apps for Nitro chains in Rust, C & C++, live on testnet
* Polygon Chain Development Kit (CDK): launch a rollup or validium
Polygon Chain Development Kit (CDK): launch a rollup or validium
* StarkWare Stone prover open sourced
StarkWare Stone prover open sourced
EIPs/Standards
* ERCs (application layer): ERC7505 : NFT author registry ERC7506 : Trusted hint
registry
* ERC7505 : NFT author registry
ERC7505 : NFT author registry
* ERC7506 : Trusted hint registry
ERC7506 : Trusted hint registry
Check out Evanâ€™s new podcast: web3 Builders
Are the permabulls lying to you (for clicks and views) about the chances for ETF
approval?
Evan says they are, Will disagrees.
Listen on Apple , Spotify or RSS .Â (Or watch on YouTube )
This is a podcast for people who appreciate nuance more than mindless shilling.
Stuff for developers
* Foundry: Rivet : developer wallet (browser extension), integrated with Anvil, alpha
Huffpoint : vm.breakpoint in Huff to use with Foundry debugger
Foundry:
* Rivet : developer wallet (browser extension), integrated with Anvil, alpha
Rivet : developer wallet (browser extension), integrated with Anvil, alpha
* Huffpoint : vm.breakpoint in Huff to use with Foundry debugger
* OpenSea redeemable NFT draft standards, proof of concept burn to redeem live on
mainnet
OpenSea redeemable NFT draft standards, proof of concept burn to redeem live on
* Unique contract designs : BIG, many to one & one to many proxies, overlapping
layouts and deeply nested variables
Unique contract designs : BIG, many to one & one to many proxies, overlapping layouts
and deeply nested variables
* Arbitrum Sepolia testnet is live, Arbitrum Goerli will be deprecated later in the
year
Arbitrum Sepolia testnet is live, Arbitrum Goerli will be deprecated later in the year
* Circomscribe : analyze Circom code
Circomscribe : analyze Circom code
* Trail of Bits adding Vyper support to Slither and Echidna
Trail of Bits adding Vyper support to Slither and Echidna
Security
* Ajna grief vector disclosed , repay debt & withdraw
Ajna grief vector disclosed , repay debt & withdraw
* Balancer disclosed vulnerability exploited for $2.1 million
Balancer disclosed vulnerability exploited for $2.1 million
* SharedStake (Liquid staking) 105 ETH exploit , infinite mint via invalid ownership
checks
SharedStake (Liquid staking) 105 ETH exploit , infinite mint via invalid ownership
Enterprise
* Swift tokenization experiments used Sepolia testnet via Chainlink CCIP
Swift tokenization experiments used Sepolia testnet via Chainlink CCIP
* OnlyFans has ETH on its balance sheet
OnlyFans has ETH on its balance sheet
Onchain stats
* Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 9 to 122 gwei, with average around 21. Negative
issuance currently at 20.1 gwei About 400 ETH net burn this week
Gas fees (via ultrasound.money ): 9 to 122 gwei, with average around 21.
* Negative issuance currently at 20.1 gwei
Negative issuance currently at 20.1 gwei
* About 400 ETH net burn this week
About 400 ETH net burn this week
* ETHUSD: $1610-1735, currently ~$1630
ETHUSD: $1610-1735, currently ~$1630
* ETHBTC : .062-.0635, currently .063 (Flippening at ~.16)
ETHBTC : .062-.0635, currently .063 (Flippening at ~.16)
Notable at app layer
* Gitcoin Grants 18 closed , $680k donated from 47k donors
Gitcoin Grants 18 closed , $680k donated from 47k donors
* Gitcoin Passport onchain stamps : mint passport on Optimism
Gitcoin Passport onchain stamps : mint passport on Optimism
* Hats Protocol v2 : assign addresses onchain roles and pick what powers each role
gets
Hats Protocol v2 : assign addresses onchain roles and pick what powers each role gets
* Brian Armstrong: startups I would build today
Brian Armstrong: startups I would build today
* Base apps: OpenCover : cover aggregator NFTA : daily price prediction game via
drawing price chart, beta
Base apps:
* OpenCover : cover aggregator
OpenCover : cover aggregator
* NFTA : daily price prediction game via drawing price chart, beta
NFTA : daily price prediction game via drawing price chart, beta
Job Listings
* Product Manager - L2 Blockchain Effort @ Status: All jobs
Product Manager - L2 Blockchain Effort @ Status: All jobs
* EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team seek ZK circuits engineer
EF Privacy & Scaling Explorations team seek ZK circuits engineer
Job listings: $600 for four issues (75 character limit).Â Questions? abcoathup
at-gmail
Regulation/business/tokens
* Grayscale procedural victory over SEC in Bitcoin ETF case : SEC must provide a
coherent response for rejection
Grayscale procedural victory over SEC in Bitcoin ETF case : SEC must provide a
* US SEC charges Impact Theory for selling NFTs as unregistered securities Unanimous
Republican dissent from Commissioners Peirce & Uyeda
US SEC charges Impact Theory for selling NFTs as unregistered securities
* Unanimous Republican dissent from Commissioners Peirce & Uyeda
* Class action against Uniswap dismissed , not liable for third-party misuse
Class action against Uniswap dismissed , not liable for third-party misuse
* Binance: BUSD users should convert to other stablecoins by February 2024
Binance: BUSD users should convert to other stablecoins by February 2024
General
* OG wallet drainer update : LastPass appears to be the common link
OG wallet drainer update : LastPass appears to be the common link
* Theft patterns of OG wallet drainer, private key compromise, sweeper bots and Sha
Zhu Pan
Theft patterns of OG wallet drainer, private key compromise, sweeper bots and Sha Zhu
Pan
* Rune proposes Maker chain, use hard forks to recover from governance attacks or tech
failures
Rune proposes Maker chain, use hard forks to recover from governance attacks or tech
* MACI & RLN trusted setup ceremonies : contribute from the browser (requires GitHub
private gist access)
MACI & RLN trusted setup ceremonies : contribute from the browser (requires GitHub
* Ittai Abraham: Fast Fourier Transform over finite fields
Ittai Abraham: Fast Fourier Transform over finite fields
* Improving log lookups using GKR
Improving log lookups using GKR
Follow @WeekinEthNews to find out what the most clicked links are. Follow @abcoathup
and @evan_van_ness to get most of the weekâ€™s news in real time.
Permalink for this weekâ€™s issue:
https://weekinethereumnews.com/week-in-ethereum-news-september-2-2023
